alert.note: Alert for North Central; Northwest; San Juan and Vicinity (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued October 26 at 5:53PM ADT until October 28 at 7:00PM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AST SATURDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AST SUNDAY... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Life-threatening breaking waves between 10 to 15 feet, and dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Beaches of San Juan and Vicinity, North Central and Northwest. * WHEN...Coastal Flood Advisory through Saturday evening, High Surf Advisory through Sunday evening and High Risk of Rip Currents through Monday. * IMPACTS...Strong currents that can carry even the strongest swimmer out to sea. Large breaking waves, dangerous rip currents and localized beach erosion. Large breaking waves that can knock persons and animals off rocks and jetties and into the sea and cause coastal erosion. Roads impassable due to salt water intrusion. * ADDITIONAL INFORMATION...The next high tide in San Juan is at 6:52 pm AST of 1.56 ft. On Friday, it is at 7:34 am and 7:35 pm AST, 1.80 ft and 1.43 ft, respectively. The next high tide in Arecibo is at 6:23 pm AST of 1.66 ft. On Friday, it is at 7:03 am and 7:10 pm AST, 1.99 ft and 1.51 ft, respectively. The next high tide in Aguadilla is at 6:16 pm AST of 1.49 ft. On Friday, it is at 6:55 am and 7:03 pm AST, 1.70 ft and 1.38 ft, respectively.
info.instruction: There is a high risk of rip currents. A High Surf Advisory means that high surf will affect beaches in the advisory area, producing localized beach erosion and dangerous swimming conditions. A Coastal Flood Advisory indicates that onshore winds and tides will combine to generate flooding of low areas along the shore.

area.areaDesc: North Central; Northwest; San Juan and Vicinity
